paper.title: On the Complexity of Generating Maximal Frequent and Minimal Infrequent Sets
paper.venue: Symposium on Theoretical Aspects of Computer Science
paper.abstract: Let A be an m Ã— n binary matrix, t ? {1, ..., m} be a threshold, and ? u003e 0 be a positive parameter. We show that given a family of O(n?) maximal t-frequent column sets for A, it is NP-complete to decide whether A has any further maximal t-frequent sets, or not, even when the number of such additional maximal t-frequent column sets may be exponentially large. In contrast, all minimal t-infrequent sets of columns of A can be enumerated in incremental quasi-polynomial time. The proof of the latter result follows from the inequality ? ? (m-t+1)s, where ? and s are respectively the numbers of all maximal t-frequent and all minimal t-infrequent sets of columns of the matrix A. We also discuss the complexity of generating all closed t-frequent column sets for a given binary matrix.
